 Who is Jesus? Jesus is God (many scriptures). As God, then he is the one who gave Moses the commandments against gay sex (Lev. 18:22; 20:13, etc.), against shacking up, and against many of the moral corruptions that liberals hold so dear. And, of course, there's more, but that's for starters.

 -Matthew 6:24

 -Proverbs 21:13
 
 "He who oppresses the poor to increase his wealth and he who gives gifts to the rich--both come to poverty."
 -Proverbs 22:16

 -Matthew 19:21

 "Then he will say to those on his left, 'Depart from me, you who are cursed, into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels. For I was hungry and you gave me nothing to eat, I was thirsty and you gave me nothing to drink, I was a stranger and you did not invite me in, I needed clothes and you did not clothe me, I was sick and in prison and you did not look after me.' He will reply, 'I tell you the truth, whatever you did not do for one of the least among you, you did not do for me.'"
 -Matthew 25:41-45

 -Proverbs 22:22-23
 
 
 
 
 "Better a poor man whose walk is blameless than a rich man whose ways are perverse."

 -Proverbs 28:11
 
 "You evildoers frustrate the plans of the poor, but the Lord is their refuge."

 I agree, actually. Clearly defining such terms is a good thing. In this case, how about we use the standard dictionary definition:from discriminate: "to make a difference in treatment or favor on a basis other than individual merit" - Merriam Webster's
 By that definition it's discrimination; just warranted discrimination. And of course, society has to set it's standards on what is considered warranted or not.

 Source: Amy Fagan, "Study Finds Gay Unions Brief," The Washington Times, July 11, 2003.
 
 http://www.washtimes.com/national/20030711-121254-3711r.htm
 
 FACT: In July 2000, Vermont legalized same-sex civil unions. Three years later, the University of Vermont conducted a poll of the state's homosexual men. When asked whether sex outside of marriage was immoral, only 34% of the homosexual men, who claimed to be in committed relationships, found anything wrong with extramarital sex.
 
 Source: Amy Fagan, "Study Finds Gay Unions Brief," The Washington Times, July 11, 2003.
 
 http://www.washtimes.com/national/20030711-121254-3711r.htm
 
 FACT: A Canadian study of homosexual men who had been in committed relationships lasting longer than one year found that only 25% of those interviewed reported being monogamous. According to study author Barry Adam, "Gay culture allows men to explore different...forms of relationships besides the monogamy coveted by heterosexuals."
 
 Source: Ryan Lee, "Gay Couples Likely to Try Non-monogamy, Study Shows," Washington Blade, August 22, 2003.
 
 http://www.washblade.com/2003/8-22/news/national/nonmonog.cfm
 
 FACT: Researchers from the University of California at San Francisco found that 36% of HIV-positive homosexual and bisexual men engaging in unprotected oral, anal, or vaginal sex failed to disclose that they were HIV positive to casual sex partners.
 
 Source: Jon Garbo, "Gay and Bi Men Less Likely to Disclose They Have HIV," Gay Health News, July 18, 2000.
 
 http://www.gayhealth.com/templates/0/news?record=136
 
 FACT: A study published in the International Journal of Epidemiology revealed that 20-year-old gay and bisexual men in a Canadian metropolis face a life expectancy that is 8-20 years less than the life expectancy of a heterosexual man in the same environment. The report concluded that gay and bisexual men now face a life expectancy rate that is similar to rates experienced by all Canadian men in the year 1871. 
 
 Source: "Modeling the Impact of HIV Disease on Mortality in Gay and Bisexual Men," International Journal of Epidemiology #26, 1997. 
 
 FACT: The Journal of Consulting and Clinical Psychologists reported that "lesbian" women face higher rates of alcohol abuse. 
 
 A whopping 19.4% of lesbian women engaged in "binge drinking" (compared with 11.7% of heterosexual women). Seven percent of lesbians were considered "heavy drinkers" as opposed to only 2.7% of heterosexual women. 
 
 Source: "Study: Alcohol Use More Prevalent for Lesbians," The Washington Blade, January 12, 2001, p. 21.
 
 FACT: A study published by Nursing Research found that lesbian women are three times more likely to abuse alcohol and suffer addictions to other chemical substances.
 
 Source: "Sexually Transmitted Infections and Risk Behaviors in Women Who Have Sex with Women," Sexually Transmitted Infections, July 2000. 
 
 More here:
 
 http://www.reclaimamerica.org/Pages/News/news.aspx?story=1901
 
 Hardly a healthy lifestyle to build a nation on.

Gay marriage is an offense to God, Hanks.

 Biblical literalists have the right to think so. However, you live in a country that separates religion from politics, don't you? Imagine some hypothetical future in which ultra-orthodox Jews control the US government. Would they be justified in forbidding you to work on Saturdays, on religious grounds?

 Hardly a healthy lifestyle to build a nation on.

 Funny how the RR rail against the 'nanny state' when it threatens to restrict their freedoms, but invoke it so self-righteously when they want to restrict the freedoms of others.

Biblical literalists have the right to think so. However, you live in a country that separates religion from politics, don't you?

 
 Most of us don't separate Godly morals from our country's institutions. Never have. If you think we do you don't know America.

 Ah, so now we're looking for an excuse to control other people's lives because they may have unhealthy lifestyles.

 
 Hey - they can go out in the woods and say their vows for all I care. We're just not going to legitimize sodomy / gay marriage.
 
 
 
 Funny how the RR rail against the 'nanny state' when it threatens to restrict their freedoms, but invoke it so self-righteously when they want to restrict the freedoms of others.

 
 Funny how you're always on the wrong side of God and still want life and liberty. As our founding fathers wrote, these liberties come from our Creator - not from some morally debased gaggle of infidels.

Most of us don't separate Godly morals from our country's institutions. Never have. If you think we do you don't know America.

 
 Just because you can not seperate church from state doesn't mean the rest of us can't. Fact is that we can seperate church and state. I would becareful because as the number of religious church going people decline you might find massive restrictions on religion if you keep pushing your religion on others.
 
 
 
 

 Hey - they can go out in the woods and say their vows for all I care. We're just not going to legitimize sodomy / gay marriage.

 
 Here is what you don't seem to understand. I would be happy if all marriages where done away with. Either equal marriage for all or marriage for no one. I am happy with the bans on gay marriage as long as heterosexuals are also denied marriage.
 
 
 

 Funny how you're always on the wrong side of God and still want life and liberty. As our founding fathers wrote, these liberties come from our Creator - not from some morally debased gaggle of infidels.

 
 The founders would be appulled by what your fellow evangelicals are tring to do in making this a christian nation.

Hypothetical.

 Uh, yes ... I said it was.
 
However, Orthodox Jews wouldn't approve of gay marriage either.

 You have the most astounding ability to miss the point. It matters not a whit whether Orthodox Jews approve of gay marriage or not: the point at issue was whether people holding certain religious beliefs have the right to impose the consequences of those beliefs on others who do not share them.
 
Funny how you're always on the wrong side of God and still want life and liberty.

 That is the most remarkable non sequitur I've read in a long while.
 
As our founding fathers wrote, these liberties come from our Creator - not from some morally debased gaggle of infidels.

 Your founding fathers were writing rhetoric, not theology. There is precious little in the bible that promotes democracy (though a great deal that seeks to legitimise autocracy).

Well if it is a democracy and that is the way the majority want to go then technically yes. I am stressing on the word consequences here

 We're in danger of going full circle here, I think. I wasn't involved in the early stages of this exchange, but unless I'm mistaken one of the concerns was the idea of 'tyrrany of the majority'. A voting majority may have the legal power to impose their will on an unwilling minority; but if the behaviour they seek to control is harmless to others, the moral right to control it is another thing altogether.
